stack writes:
> The user manual has a coarse description.  See '8.2.1. crawl.log' in 
> http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html.  It could be 
> tightened up.  Send over your doc. and I'll add it in if its better than 
> whats currently in the user manual Tom.

Of course when I went looking the User Manual wasn't available online
yet. What I ended up with is pretty much what's there. I would find it
more readable if there weren't links to the glossary --- I'd rather
see the information inlined, and perhaps include some examples.

Also the annotations field can also contain timeTrunc and lenTrunc
annotations, in addition to the number of attempts.

    -tree
